1.text: Tap clams with an open shell and toss them if they don't close.

2.text: Soak the clams in cool saltwater for 1 hour to remove any sand.

3.text: Transfer the clams to another bowl of clean saltwater and soak for 20 minutes.

4.text: Scrub the clams under running water to remove remaining dirt.

5.text: Fill a large pot halfway with water.

6.text: Add any seasonings to the water that you want to use.

7.text: Bring the water to a boil over a high heat.

8.text: Add other ingredients like vegetables or sausage if you’re using them.

9.text: Pour the clams into the boiling water.

10.text: Boil the clams for 8-10 minutes, until they open.

11.text: Scoop the ingredients into a colander to drain.

12.text: Discard any clams that didn’t open.

13.text: Serve the clams plain or as part of a larger meal.
